intro: Mohria caffrorum, commonly known as the Cape mohria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, berry-like fruits that are an important food source for local wildlife. Mohria caffrorum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
